title: Approximate Number Equality
description: In this lab, we will explore how to implement a function in JavaScript that checks if two numbers are approximately equal to each other. We will use the Math.abs() method to compare the absolute difference between the two values to a specified or default epsilon value. This lab will help us understand how to handle floating-point numbers with precision in JavaScript.

meta.title: Implementing Approximate Number Equality in JavaScript
meta.description: Learn how to write a JavaScript function to check if two numbers are approximately equal, using the Math.abs() method and an optional epsilon value.
meta.keywords: javascript, javascript practice, math, javascript tutor, javascript practice online, floating point, javascript lab, approximation, precision

verify.name: Verify Node Commands In Zsh History
verify.hint: JavaScript can be run in the Terminal/SSH by typing 'node' and pressing Enter.
